definition: to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: Placebos work, doctors believed, because the mind is a powerful thing.
sentences.chinese: 医生们相信安慰剂起作用，是因为念力是一种力量。

sentences.english: All those who believe in psychokinesis, raise my hand.
sentences.chinese: 相信念力之人，请举起我的手。

sentences.english: There is a lot of work left to do, and we would need all the help available to that intend.
sentences.chinese: 还有许多工作要做，我们需要所有意识念力的帮助。

sentences.english: You’ll need to use your Jedi Mind Tricks wisely.
sentences.chinese: 你要聪明地运用你的绝地念力。

definition: occult force/the power of a God or spirit
to spare time for a separate task/doppelgänger/sockpuppet (Internet slang)
to implement the law/to perform sorcery
stars of the Big Dipper that constitute the tail of the dipper
